subject: New York, New York
event: It's a helluva town. The Bronx is up and the Battery's down. The people all ride in a hole in the ground. Also, it's the headquarters for all your GAME OF THRONES merchandising needs. Just check out the HBO store at 1100 Avenue of the Americas (Sixth Avenue, for you out of towners). The shop was transformed last night into the official GAME OF THRONESD headquarters -- the first and only one of its kind the world. All of the merchandise from HBO's on-line shop will be offered at the store. The shop has also gas props straight from the set on display, and GAME OF THRONES content running on the multimedia components. So it's museum as well as a shop. HBO plays to update continually over the next several months with rotating displays, official merchandiing and promotions. So New Yorkers... get down into that hole in the ground. Visit early! Visit often! OOOOHHH and AAAHHHHH. And while you're in town, have a pizza for me at one of the many great NYC pizza places. This is the best thing to happen to NYC since the Giants won the SuperBowl.

comments.article: Hopefully we don't have to pay the "Dwarf's Penny" on any merchandise.

Amazing photos -- hat's off to whoever sent you those. Though I admit, the lock next to the dragon eggs is stumping me ... the lock from the chest they're kept in, perhaps?

Wish there was more Night's Watch stuff -- or maybe a maester's chain, at least, that'd have been neat to see close up.

The Maester's Path is still running, for those who want to get a clip with Tyrion, the Old Bear, and Maester Aemon. Not too long before the penultimate link goes out, too!
I'm so there.
Woo Hoo!  Looks like a bounty of good loot.  Love them dragon eggs!
comments.subject: New York New York

comments.article: This is more cool than a cool thing on a cool day.

OMG, stopping by tomorrow on my way home from work!!!! <3
I needed to pick up make-up at Sephora's anyway, so yay!

It's a helluva town. The Bronx is up and the Battery's down. The people all ride in a hole in the ground.

Not to mention all the Aces and Jokers ... ;-)
I may just need to road trip this.

For a good, cheap NYC pizza I highly recommend Little Italy Pizza on 45th St, just a few blocks up from the HBO store.

Gonna have to check this out, maybe tomorrow. Got to see all those props.
I didn't know there were any pizza places in Manhattan north of Spring St.
It looks amazing!  It's so exciting to see the essence of the books standing there in windows or laid out on shelves.
Very cool!  Wish I was close enough to stop in.  It's nice to see that you are FINALLY getting the kind of recognition you deserve for your amazing work.

Do you have a recommendation for a good pizza place? I live in the city, and I always like finding out what other people's favorites are.

Also, the stuff in the store looks pretty cool. I like how they handled the decorative elements of the armor.

But...sadly the Stark banner is just the direwolf head. I hope HBO has two variations. I know lots of fans are and were hoping to see full direwolf body tshirts and banners. Hopefully the banners, if HBO sells banners, are shorter in length

Awesome to see all that cool stuff.
comments.subject: I see banners.

comments.upictitle: The Knight in Shining Skull T-shirt: pic#106375917
comments.article: That's where I live! I'll have to drop in.
Definitely Heading up to NYC soon
comments.subject: Road Trip

comments.article: sweet!
Then again these could be banners from the prop department on display *facepalm*duh!
comments.subject: I see banners.

comments.article: On the Town reference ftw!

comments.upictitle: bronxelf (The NYC Chamber of Commerce in Chucks.): winter 2014
comments.article:
Excuse me... but you have that reversed. It's 6th Avenue to the natives and Avenue of The Americas (ugh) for the tourists.

:)
Bronx is right on that, I have to say.  (No, I wasn't born here, but by now I've lived here nearly half my life, so close enough to a native I think.)
All the good pizza is in Brooklyn now. But this might be worth crossing the bridge back into Manhattan to see.

Mr. Martin, congratulations. Long time reader, first time poster (I think, maybe once before).

I have a question you may or may not know the answer to. Do you know if there are any plans for a Game of Thrones prop auction? I know that often props from movies or shows are auctioned off, either for profit or charity, and I would absolutely LOVE to get... well, basically anything from the set of the show.
comments.subject: Props

comments.article: Looks like *somebody* got into the Guinness today!  Haha but seriously great pictures, and I nearly dropped the laptop here when I saw the Hound's helm.  One month!
I wanna dragon egg, I wanna dragon egg, I wanna dragon egg.
AWESOME!  Cannot wait to check it out!
